Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the frequency at which 9/11 survivors or responders die from 9/11-related cancer by stating that it happens "almost every day."
Lack enough support: While the claim provides some statistics and references to studies, it may lack sufficient evidence to support the assertion that "almost every day" a 9/11 survivor or responder dies from 9/11-related cancer.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all deaths from 9/11-related cancer are directly linked to the attacks, without considering other potential causes or factors.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the deaths of 9/11 survivors or responders, such as unrelated health conditions or factors not directly related to the attacks.
